title: Herbed Quinoa Stuffing
description: Gluten Free, Higher Fiber, Lower Saturated Fat, Lower Sodium
cleaned_text: stuffing has an earthy flavor that includes tons of mushrooms, kale, and fresh herbs. Serves: 12 (serving= 1/2 cup) Ingredients - 3 cups water - 1 ½ cups uncooked quinoa - 1 Tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil - 1 large onion, chopped - 16 ounce container mushrooms, wiped cleaned and roughly chopped - 6 cups kale leaves, stems removed, roughly chopped - 2 teaspoons minced garlic (about 4 cloves) - ¼ cup walnuts, chopped - 2 Tablespoons fresh sage, chopped - 2 Tablespoons fresh thyme, chopped - 1 teaspoon salt - 1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese Directions - Add quinoa and 3 cups water to a medium saucepan. Bring to boil, then simmer on medium-low for 10-12 minutes or until all liquid is soaked up. - Place large skillet on medium-high heat, add oil, onions, mushrooms and kale. Put lid on and cook for 7-10 minutes (mushrooms should be semi-soft and kale wilted). Add garlic, walnuts, sage, thyme and salt. Stir to combine. - In a large bowl, combine quinoa with skillet ingredients and stir well. - Once plated, top with ½ Tablespoon of parmesan cheese.
